title: Photographer reveals Duchess of Cambridge's trick to look more photogenic
text:
The Duchess of Cambridge, also known as Kate Middleton, has been in the public eye for more than a decade, her first high profile public event with Prince William falling in April 2008.

As anyone who’s seen photos of the 37-year-old knows, she is extremely photogenic – a point recently commented upon by photographer Terence O'Neill, known as Terry, when he was presented with his CBE for services to photography by the Duke of Cambridge at Buckingham Palace on Tuesday.

O'Neill praised the Duchess of Cambridge’s photographic skill, calling her a “very good” photographer. The Duchess of Cambridge has taken a number of high-profile photographs in the past which have been shared with media outlets, including three new photos of Prince Louis released to celebrate his first birthday in April this year.

Asked who his favourite photographic subject was, O'Neill – who has photographed the likes of Winston Churchill and Nelson Mandela to Elvis Presley and Nicole Kidman – told the PA news agency it had to be the Duchess of Cambridge.

"There have been some incredible people," he said. "I couldn't really even compare - his (the Duke of Cambridge's) wife is also an excellent subject."

But, good looks aside, what exactly is it about the Duchess which makes her so photogenic?

It’s a combination of preparation (strategically planned makeup, hair and outfits) and how she composes herself in front of the camera, explains photographer Grace Robinson.

The Duchess of Cambridge is regularly pictured side on. [Photo: Getty] More

Hair and makeup

“Kate's hair is always styled to perfection, her most common style is loose waves, or curls, and it’s always pushed to the front of her shoulders,” says Robinson. “This frames the face perfect for any image as her hair colour compliments her skin tone and makeup perfectly.”

Her makeup is also always “photo-ready”, with a natural look. “She never goes over the top - too much makeup or the incorrect makeup style for your face shape can really show up negatively on camera,” adds Robinson.

Style

The Duchess “knows what outfits work best for her” and dresses in a specific way if she is going to be photographed at events – adding volume to her bottom half – which is more flattering, explains Robinson.

“She has a slim figure, so her dresses and outfits usually accentuate the top half of the body and are loose fitting from the waist downwards. This is not only flattering for Kates body shape but more comfortable when sitting and gives photographs movement and life when walking,” she adds.

Posture

As for when she’s in the limelight, the Duchess does three things to make herself look more photogenic, Robinson reveals.

The Duchess of Cambridge often wears clothing which adds volume to her bottom half. [Photo: Getty] More

Her number one trick is that she always faces the camera side on when photographs are being taken – “this way the face looks slimmer and the jaw line is accentuated,” says Robinson. “She is rarely photographed front on, which can cause loss of definition in the face in photographs.”

As for the rest, the Duchess always makes sure she smiles in public – “this brings energy and warmth to her photographs” – and maintains perfect posture: “Smiling is infectious and encourages the photographer to keep snapping until they get the perfect shot,” finishes Robinson.
description: As anyone who’s seen photos of the 37-year-old knows, she is extremely photogenic.
